sections.title: Goals of Writing Quality Control function
bullets: Deliver both accuracy and proper communication between app and customers
Enhance menu quality; unify the standard of writing in all markets

sections.title: Capitalization
sections.why: Marks start of sentences or highlights importance of specific words
rules_capitalize: Names, cities, days, nationalities, and months
Capitalize words in new sentences (after full stops)
rules_do_not_capitalize: After numbers (e.g., 3), except for item names, category names, and option names

sections.title: Spelling
notes: A change of any letter can change meaning; many source menus arrive with errors
Double-check you’re copying items properly from the menu
recommendations: Use Google Trends to compare common usage
Use Microsoft Word/OS text suggestions; Grammarly optional

special: Half: ½ (to be checked for JOR)
ml and mL are used interchangeably per context

sections.title: Translation
principles: We translate catalogues into Arabic; do not rely solely on vendor translations
Use Google Translate and verify; check competitors; use Glossary sheet
word_order_rules: Describing word (adjective/nationality) comes first; main noun follows (e.g., 'Danish Pastries', 'English Cake')
If a name has two main nouns (e.g., 'Chicken Curry'), both orders can be valid—choose the common usage

sections.title: Common Errors & Corrections
item_level: If an item has three words, capitalize each word’s first letter (e.g., 'Desert Oasis Cooler')
Do not capitalize articles (a, an, the) in item names
description_level: Do not capitalize after a colon; write 'served with …'
Add a period at the end of each description

customizations.title_rule: Treat customization titles like sentences—only the first letter capitalized (e.g., 'Choose size')
customizations.options_rule: Treat customization options like items—capitalize each word’s first letter (e.g., 'Extra Onion')
